    Smart Walking Stick

    Description

    Smart Walking Stick is a final year capstone project for Computer Engineering student in University of Ottawa. The idea came when I realized the difficulties faced by impaired vision people in their daily life when they only depend on the old single featured of walking stick. I was thinking that the walking stick can be improvise by adding some latest technology features to improved the user experience and aid the impaired vision people. Along with 3 other teammates who agreed with this idea as a Capstone project, we worked on this project for a year.

    Technical

    Some main features that was implemented on the walking stick such as SOS Emergency notifier, obstacles detector and Indoor Navigation System (INS). As we knew, Global Positioning System (GPS) does not work inside building which caused any navigation application such as Google Maps, Apple Maps and etc will not work inside building. Thus, we decided to implement our own INS using RFID technology and some algorithm.

    What I did

    I was responsible for back-end and front-end development. For the back-end, I setup, managed and monitor AWS for the API request. I wrote API using NodeJS for best route finding API and also implemented Djikstra's Algorithm to improve the efficiency for the computation

    For the front-end, my teammates and I developed an Android application for the user and implemented a voice recognition feature where it allows the user to use the application by giving out command with just one tap

    +
    Virqueue Start-up

    Description

    Virqueue is a start-up company that was launched 2017 in Malaysia that developed a mobile application for advance mobile food ordering and restaurant's Point of Sale system. I am one of the co-founders of Virqueue along with three other co-founders who are also my friends. The idea was came when we realized there is no advance food ordering system in Malaysia and we would like to facilitate workers in Malaysia who got a limited lunch hours. Unfortunately, the start-up company did not make through since we are not able to find investors and all other co-founders decided to back off.

    Technical

    Virqueue application able to make advance mobile ordering for its user. The user able to setup automatic advanced mobile ordering system for each day so they dont have to open the application and order food everyday. The application also allows user to make a advance reservation at any applicable restaurant with just one tap.

    What I did

    I was a full stack developer for this start-up. I did front-end development using React-native with additional tools/technology such as Redux to improve the efficiency of the application.

    I wrote and developed RESTful APIs for the application using NodeJS. I also responsible to setup, maintained and monitored the server using Amazon Web Services (AWS)

    +
    MySukan 2017

    Description

    MySukan is an annual sport event for Malaysian students in Ontario. In 2017, MySukan was held in Ottawa and Malaysian students in Ottawa became the organizer for the event. As a part of the organizer team, my friend and I developed a mobile application to facilitate the event and to help all the participants that are coming from all over the places in Ontario.

    Technical

    MySukan 2017 mobile application has many features. The main feature of this mobile application is to show the live score of each sport so every participants/users will able to keep updated of their team's score especially for those who could not watch/attend the match. Other than that, the application has push notification that allows administrator/organizer to send a reminder or annoucement to all the participants.

    What I did

    I was one of the Android developers for the application. I developed the functionality of live score by using real time database (Firebase) to store all the live data. For the push notification, I also used Firebase to store the data and used the Firebase Messaging Service to implement the push notification.

    +
    ML: Titanic Disaster

    Description

    Machine Learning: Titanic Disaster is a end of semester coursework project for Artificial Intelligence course in University of Ottawa. We chose this idea as there was a competition on Kaggle to build a machine learning to predict the survivability of Titanic passengers based on dataset given. After consulted with my professor, she agreed to let my ground to use the competition on Kaggle as a part of my coursework project and asked me present the result in class.

    Technical

    There were three approaches used to build the machine learning to predict the survivability of titanic disaster; Random Forest, Deep Logistic Regression and Naive Bayes. All three approaches gave different results and the result improved when the dataset was filtered with only important feature of the passanger.

    What I did

    I was responsible to use the Naive Bayes approach to setup the machine learning. I used Python to wrote the machine learning code with the help of Scikit Learn tools to implement Naive Bayes approach. I also filtered the dataset with only important feature of the passenger based on my research of the titanic disaster. For example, there was a rumour that during the tragedy, women and children were prioritzed to board the emergency boat, thus I filtered the dataset with Sex and Ages to get higher accuracy in predicting whether a passenger will surive or not.
